EmpiNull 1.0.0

Estimate Empirical Null Parameters with provider-level Confounding Factors

empirical_null_CF_prov.Rd

Estimate Empirical Null Parameters with provider-level Confounding Factors

Usage

empirical_null_CF_prov(
  Obs,
  Exp,
  W,
  p.grid = seq(0.4, 0.999, 0.001),
  cutoff = 0.975,
  family = "poisson"
)

Arguments

Obs

Numeric vector of observed counts

Exp

Numeric vector of expected counts

W

TBD

p.grid

Numeric vector of candidate \(p_0\) values for grid search. Default: seq(0.4, 0.999, 0.001).

cutoff

Numeric scalar in (0,1); quantile used to form initial truncation bounds. Default: 0.975.

family

Character scalar; model family. Supported: "poisson" (default) or "approx poisson".

Value

A list with elements:

nu_hat

Estimated coefficient vector \(\hat{\nu}\) (length P).

sig2_hat

Estimated variance component \(\hat{\sigma}^2\).

p0

Selected null proportion \(p_0\) (grid minimum).

nu_var

Estimated covariance matrix of \(\hat{\nu}\).

W

The centered design matrix used in fitting.

(unnamed)

Integer indices of observations outside the truncation window (i.e., those with Z_FE < aorig or Z_FE > borig).
